contentfulBlogPost.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with Hospitalization Numbers

childMarkdownRemark.html: Dave Luo has an MD/MBA and is a Data Science and Data Viz lead at The COVID Tracking Project.

Catherine Pollack is a third year PhD candidate in the Quantitative Biomedical Sciences program at Dartmouth College. Her dissertation research combines data science, epidemiology, and public policy to combat online health misinformation.
Kara Schechtman is Data Quality Co-Lead for The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID-19 Testing Data Is Getting Better

lede.lede: The federal government improved its state and county-level COVID-19 PCR testing data since we analyzed it in February. Here’s an update on those changes and what we hope to see next for the data.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Alice Goldfarb leads The COVID Tracking Project’s part in The COVID Racial Data Tracker, and is a Nieman Visiting Fellow.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: What We Know About Race and Ethnicity Data

lede.lede: Publicly available federal race and ethnicity COVID-19 data is currently usable and improving, although it shares many of the problems we’ve found in state-reported data.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Erin Kissane is a co-founder of the COVID Tracking Project, and the project’s managing editor.
Jessica Malaty Rivera has an MS in Emerging Infectious Diseases and is the Science Communication Lead at The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: How Not to Interpret COVID-19 Data

lede.lede: Beware of dating schemes, data dumps, weather events and other issues that can lead to mistakes that confuse the public.

childMarkdownRemark.html: The COVID Tracking Project is a volunteer organization launched from The Atlantic and dedicated to collecting and publishing the data required to understand the COVID-19 outbreak in the United States.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: How to Find Data

lede.lede: Here’s where and how you can find COVID-19 data now that The COVID Tracking Project has ended.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Zach Lipton is a San Francisco software developer and Data Infrastructure co-lead for the COVID Tracking Project.
Dave Luo has an MD/MBA and is a Data Science and Data Viz lead at The COVID Tracking Project.
Peter Walker is Head of Marketing & Growth at PublicRelay and Data Viz Co-Lead at The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data in a Single Stream

lede.lede: We’ve created a bit of code that helps combine federal testing, case, deaths, and hospitalization data into a single spreadsheet.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Dave Luo has an MD/MBA and is a Data Science and Data Viz lead at The COVID Tracking Project.

Catherine Pollack is a third year PhD candidate in the Quantitative Biomedical Sciences program at Dartmouth College. Her dissertation research combines data science, epidemiology, and public policy to combat online health misinformation.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with Hospitalization Numbers

lede.lede: Here’s a walkthrough of the Department of Health and Human Services’ dataset and what you should know about it.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Jennifer Clyde is a data quality and data entry shift lead at the COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with Case Data

lede.lede: Here’s a walkthrough of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) daily case dataset and what you should know about it.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Erin Kissane is a co-founder of the COVID Tracking Project, and the project’s managing editor.

blog_post.title: Where to Find Simple COVID-19 Data for the US

lede.lede: As The COVID Tracking Project approaches its final day of data compilation on March 7, 2021, we are recommending a selection of federal data sources to people who want a quick and easy way to keep an eye on the pandemic.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Joseph Bensimon is a member of the COVID Tracking Project’s Data Quality team.
Quang P. Nguyen is a PhD candidate in the Department of Epidemiology at Dartmouth College.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with Death Numbers

lede.lede: The CDC provides two different datasets regarding COVID-19 fatalities. Here’s a walkthrough of how they compare to each other and to The COVID Tracking Project’s data.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Artis Curiskis is outreach & reporting co-lead at the COVID Tracking Project and collaboratively runs the CTP special projects Long-Term Care COVID Tracker and City Data.
Kara Oehler is outreach & reporting co-lead at the COVID Tracking Project and collaboratively runs the CTP special projects Long-Term Care COVID Tracker and City Data.
Aarushi Sahejpal is a Shift Lead on Long-Term Care and City Data at the COVID Tracking Project. She also studies International Relations & Data Science at American University
Dave Luo has an MD/MBA and is a Data Science and Data Viz lead at The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with CMS Nursing Home Data

lede.lede: Here’s what we know about the only federal dataset on COVID-19 outcomes in long-term care facilities.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Kara Schechtman is Data Quality Co-Lead for The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Federal COVID Data 101: Working with Testing Data

lede.lede: At least three different federal agencies share testing data for SARS-CoV-2 in at least four different places. Here’s a little about where that data comes from, what each dataset has to offer, and how you can use the datasets best in light of their large differences from state-provided data.

childMarkdownRemark.html: Rachel Glickhouse is a New York-based journalist who works on project management and impact tracking at The COVID Tracking Project.

blog_post.title: Learn More About Using Federal COVID-19 Data with The COVID Tracking Project

lede.lede: In February and March, we’ll hold a series of free trainings to help anyone who uses our data to understand existing federal numbers.

blogContent.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The COVID-19 hospitalization dataset published by the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) provides a comprehensive look over time at the state of COVID-19 hospitalizations within the United States. The dataset includes many hospital capacity and usage metrics, including, for example, the current number of adult and pediatric patients who are suspected or confirmed to have COVID-19 hospitalized in inpatient and intensive care unit (ICU) beds. Each of these metrics are reported by every US hospital every day, with the exception of psychiatric and rehabilitation hospitals, which report weekly. ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"More than 6,000 hospitals report","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://protect-public.hhs.gov/datasets/9f70e309bb324d3f96c49a3ead7be776/data?geometry=89.569%2C-16.702%2C-96.408%2C72.161&orderBy=state_name"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" to HHS either directly or via their state or state hospital associations, and the underlying dataset is publicly accessible and used across federal and state agencies: The CDC uses this hospitalization data in their ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"COVID-19 Data Tracker","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", and it is included in the publicly available ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Community Profile Reports","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/National/COVID-19-Community-Profile-Report/gqxm-d9w9"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"State Profile Reports","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/browse?tags=covid-19-spr"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"HealthData.gov","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/browse?tags=hhs+covid-19"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", a public repository of government health datasets, contains various “slices” of the dataset, including state- and facility-level measures over time. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"embedded-entry-block","content":[],"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6W9vYKNLQzRIR6SDKRTptP","type":"Link","linkType":"Entry"}}}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Since the dataset’s public release in various stages from July to December, The COVID Tracking Project has conducted a series of analyses that found that the data is now remarkably close to our own estimates. After adjusting for variations in definitions and reporting lags, the HHS data for current COVID-19 hospitalizations nationwide is usually within a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"few percentage points","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covidtracking.com/analysis-updates/what-weve-learned-about-the-hhs-hospitalization-data"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" of the data we compile from state dashboards. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"embedded-entry-block","content":[],"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"6I0CKNYUJ4bOua8bzv8DcX","type":"Link","linkType":"Entry"}}}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"One of the greatest advantages of the HHS data is the standardization across states and hospital facilities of which metrics are collected and how they are defined—something that our dataset lacks. This standardization includes the separation of confirmed and suspected COVID-19 cases within both inpatient and ICU stays. The HHS data also includes COVID-19 admissions—again separated by confirmed and suspected COVID-19—which is broken down further in the facility-level dataset by 10-year age brackets. It also includes how many hospitals are reporting staffing shortages today and within a week. Further, the facility-level granularity present in the HHS data allows us to evaluate trends occurring at each hospital and on various geographic levels, including by ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"hospital service area and hospital referral region","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covidtracking.com/analysis-updates/new-hhs-dataset-tells-us-precisely-where-COVID-19-is-hitting-hospitals"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Where to get the data","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The HHS data can be viewed in multiple locations, including the","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":" CDC COVID-19 Data Tracker","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#county-view"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", which aggregates the data to county-level “hospital utilization” metrics like new admissions and percentage of staffed beds used by COVID-19 patients. The ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"HHS Protect Public Data Hub","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://protect-public.hhs.gov/pages/hospital-utilization"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" page on hospital utilization provides a searchable map of hospital utilization by facility, dashboards of inpatient and ICU bed utilization by state. We have also ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"created","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covidtracking.com/analysis-updates/visualizing-covid-19s-impact-on-hospitals"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" an ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"interactive map","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://covidtracking.com/data/hospital-facilities"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" that provides searchable information from the HHS facility-level dataset on all inpatient and ICU COVID-19 patients currently hospitalized in each hospital facility in the latest reporting week. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The “raw” data is also publicly available for download at ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"HealthData.gov","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/browse?tags=hhs+covid-19"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", but analysis may require additional data analysis tools (such as Excel or Google Sheets or a statistical programming language) given the size of the dataset (over 18,000 rows and 60 columns for the state-level time series data and over 130,000 rows and 90 columns for the facility-level time series data).","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"These screenshots show how to access the data housed at HealthData.gov. For the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"state-level hospitalization time series","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/g62h-syeh"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", data users should check the update date and time for the data, and use the button labeled “Export” to get a CSV file or explore the data directly on the site using the “View Data” or “Visualize” options. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"embedded-entry-block","content":[],"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"7oy5cxWDaUMFF9R968tAIc","type":"Link","linkType":"Entry"}}}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"For the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"facility-level hospitalization time series","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/anag-cw7u"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", we recommend carefully reading the data element descriptions on the download page and then following the same process of verifying the update date and time and using the “Export” button to get the relevant CSV file.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"embedded-entry-block","content":[],"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"3YOQJegKgCkaEekQ60g2AC","type":"Link","linkType":"Entry"}}}},{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Notes on using the data","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"state-level data","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/g62h-syeh"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", each row corresponds to one state for one day going back to March 2020; the data is updated regularly on Mondays, and prior updates and tracking of revisions (such as backfills and corrections) are available on the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"corresponding archive repository page","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/dataset/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/qqte-vkut"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". In the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"facility-level data","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/anag-cw7u"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", each row represents one facility’s daily reported data averaged for each “collection” week, which spans Friday through Thursday going back to August 2020. This data also updates on Mondays and prior updates are available at the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"corresponding archive repository page","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/dataset/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/j4ip-wfsv"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Although the hospitalization data in the state-level time series goes back to March 2020, it started to become significantly more complete and broader in scope starting July 15, 2020, when the hospital data reporting system switched to HHS Protect. Shortly after this switch, hospital reporting on the majority of data fields also became mandatory. Data before July 15, 2020 came from the prior reporting system (CDC’s National Healthcare Safety Network system) and was voluntarily reported by hospitals. We advise caution when interpreting hospitalization data trends from earlier in the pandemic when hospital reporting was less complete. See the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"HHS Protect Public Data Hub page on hospital reporting","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://protect-public.hhs.gov/pages/hospital-reporting"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" for details on the current completeness of hospitalization data to the individual facility-level and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"how this reporting has improved over time","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/stories/s/vwaj-ban6"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In addition to the state-level time series which updates weekly, provisional daily updates of hospitalizations at the state-level can be found in a separate ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"data page","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/dataset/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/6xf2-c3ie"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" (and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"archive repository","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/d/4cnb-m4rz"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":") at HealthData.gov. This daily update file provides the same data fields as the state-level time series but solely for the most recent date of data available. Each update to this file is a new snapshot of state-level hospitalization metrics at that time of update. Be cautious in interpreting large changes seen in these daily updates which may be due to incomplete or anomalous reporting. These errors are often corrected later on in the weekly update to the time series file.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In the facility-level data, to protect patient privacy, values between 0 and 4 have been replaced with -999999, so caution should be taken to preprocess the data to appropriately summarize and calculate values. Further, facilities that do not report every day, as well as facilities operated by the Defense Health Agency, Veterans Affairs, and Indian Health Service, are not included within the facility-level data. Due to this being a smaller subset of facilities, weekly averaging of reported daily numbers, and replacement of 0-4 values by -999999, summing up the facility-level data will not exactly match the totals in the state-level dataset. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"There are many helpful resources available to answer questions on the data, including the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"HHS’s hospital reporting FAQ","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://www.hhs.gov/sites/default/files/covid-19-faqs-hospitals-hospital-laboratory-acute-care-facility-data-reporting.pdf"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", individual data dictionaries for the state-level and facility-level time series data, and even a ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"community-created FAQ for the facility-level data","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://github.com/CareSet/COVID_Hospital_PUF"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" on Github. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"heading-3","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The hospitalization dataset is great—and could be even better","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The HHS hospitalization data has been instrumental in communicating the state of the pandemic at a granular level. We think a few changes would strengthen the data even further. Our top suggestion for the HHS team would be to improve access to the dataset via an API that includes paginated results and the ability to query in order to obtain more specific, smaller segments of the overall dataset. This is especially important as the dataset continues to grow with each day and week’s additional rows, and its successful implementation could enhance accessibility and reproducibility of future analyses. (","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Update on 3/11/2021:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" These improvements are currently in development with the dataset migration to ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"beta.HealthData.gov","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}],"data":{"uri":"https://beta.healthdata.gov/"}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". This new site runs on the Socrata data platform, which provides SQL-like querying features and an API.)","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A smaller but important improvement would be to provide an option to download only one state’s data at a time, which could help to facilitate localized analysis. It would also be helpful to have all the data elements that appear in the facility-level data also present in the state-level data. For example, COVID admissions are broken out by age bracket in the facility-level but not in the state-level time series.","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We believe that in its current state the data provides a critical resource for public health researchers, journalists, and policymakers alike, which will be enhanced as the dataset is improved and additional metrics are made public. Daily status reports from every hospital across the nation provides us with a uniquely reliable and fine-grained signal of how our health systems and communities are faring in the pandemic. ","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"3/11/2021: We have updated this piece with links and images to the new beta.HealthData.gov data hosting pages and more details about the hospitalization datasets available.","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

image.title: Currently Hospitalized: CTP & HHS Best Match Values, Sep 1-Feb 13
image.description: Comparing the currently hospitalized with COVID-19 national numbers from HHS and CTP shows very close alignment after adjusting for definitional differences in how each state reports its confirmed or suspected COVID-19 hospitalizations and a 1-day reporting lag in the CTP data.

references.caption: Current COVID-19 hospitalization data from states (CTP, dark blue line)  visualized over federal (HHS, lighter blue stacked bars) data of confirmed and suspected COVID-19 hospitalizations in 50 states plus DC and PR.

image.title: Comparison of state-reported CTP data with HHS data
image.description: Line and stacked bar chart for 50 states plus DC and PR comparing state-reported (CTP) data with HHS data for current confirmed and suspected COVID-19 hospitalizations. Some states report data that match best with confirmed COVID hospitalizations only while others match best with confirmed and suspected hospitalizations summed together.

image.title: Accessing the HHS state-level hospitalization timeseries dataset on beta.healthdata.gov
image.description: Screenshot of HHS state-level hospitalization timeseries dataset hosted at https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/g62h-syeh

image.title: Accessing the HHS facility-level hospitalization dataset
image.description: Screenshot of the HHS facility-level hospitalization dataset hosting page at https://beta.healthdata.gov/Hospital/COVID-19-Reported-Patient-Impact-and-Hospital-Capa/anag-cw7u

lede.lede: Here’s a walkthrough of the Department of Health and Human Services’ dataset and what you should know about it.
